channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why is Ukraine negotiating a minerals deal with the US?
item.description: A minister says nearly all key details have been finalised for a deal giving the US access to the country's minerals.

item.title: Spanish city 'adopts' migrants who intervened in homophobic attack
item.description: Ibrahima Diack and Magatte N'Diaye are given "adopted sons of the city" status in A Coruña.

item.title: 5 signs that a U.S.-Europe split is widening
item.description: As the Trump administration ramps up its rhetoric against Ukraine and NATO, European countries are taking note — with increasing alarm.

item.title: A midair collision in Arizona prompts questions about air traffic control towers
Health care workers are rushing to learn about immigration law in case of ICE raids
item.description: A policy change by the Trump administration allows immigration agents to enter and arrest people in health facilities. Some clinics are training healt...

item.title: New hunt for MH370 begins in Indian Ocean 11 years after flight vanished
item.description: The firm Ocean Infinity has launched a new search for missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 in what it says is a "more credible" patch of the Indian ...

item.title: Utah seems set to become first state to ban fluoride in public water systems
item.description: Utah appears to be the first state ready to put a full ban on fluoride in public water systems under a bill that doesn't allow cities or communities t...

item.title: Uganda probes death of Nigerian footballer in shopping mall
item.description: Abubakar Lawal, 29, reportedly fell from a third-floor balcony of a shopping mall in Kampala.

item.title: Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes loses fraud appeal
item.description: Holmes was sentenced to more than 11 years in prison for defrauding investors in her blood-testing company.

item.title: Venezuelan opposition activist dies in jail
item.description: The politician was seized by masked men a day before Nicolás Maduro was sworn in for a third term.

item.title: Illinois landlord charged with 2023 hate crime and murder of Palestinian American boy set for trial
Nearly 40% of contracts canceled by DOGE are expected to produce no savings
item.description: Nearly 40% of the federal contracts that the Trump administration claims to have canceled as part of its signature cost-cutting program aren’t expecte...

item.title: Who is Alice Marie Johnson, Trump's newly appointed 'pardon czar'?
item.description: Johnson, now 69, was facing life in prison without the possibility of parole for being a first-time nonviolent drug offender.

item.title: Trump's funding freeze threatens key river. And, U.S. votes against Ukraine peace plan
item.description: Trump's funding freezes could threaten the Colorado River. Some money was intended to keep the shrinking river flowing. And, the U.S. voted against a ...

item.title: Man accused of shooting 1-year-old daughter in front of her mother
item.description: Prosecutors say Adam Joseph Montoya carried out the crime with an AR-style rifle in front of the girl's mother.

item.title: Thousands pray for ailing Pope Francis in chilly, rainy St. Peter's Square
item.description: Thousands of people gathered in St. Peter's Square on a chilly, rainy evening to pray for an ailing Pope Francis.

item.title: Musk gives federal workers "another chance"' to justify their jobs
item.description: Elon Musk told federal workers Monday evening that they had "another chance" to justify their work or lose their jobs. The original deadline passed la...

item.title: Top Ukrainian official says Kyiv will refuse any 'bad' peace deal
